intro: Chionochloa juncea, commonly known as the alpine hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and fine, wiry leaves. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it tolerates cold and windy conditions. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Chionochloa juncea plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
